verses.text: Jesus the son of Naue \add was\add* valiant in the wars, And \add was\add* the successor of Moses in prophecies, Who according to his name was made great For the saving of the elect of God, \add And\add* taking vengeance of the enemies that rose up against \add them\add*, That he might set Israel in their inheritance.
How great glory gat he, when \add he\add* did lift up his hands, And stretched out \add his\add* sword against the cities!
Who before him so stood \add to it?\add* For the Lord himself brought \add his\add* enemies unto \add him\add*.
Did not the sun go back by his means? And was \add not\add* one day as long as two?
He called upon the most high Lord, When the enemies pressed upon him on every side; And the great Lord heard him.

\add And\add* with hailstones of mighty power He made the battle to fall violently upon the nations, And in the descent \add of Bethoron\add* he destroyed them that resisted, That the nations might know all their strength, Because he fought in the sight of the Lord, And he followed the Mighty One.

In the time of Moses also he did a \add work of\add* mercy, He and Caleb the son of Jephunne, In that \add they\add* withstood the congregation, \add And\add* withheld the people from sin, And appeased the wicked murmuring.
And of six hundred thousand people on foot, they two were preserved To bring them into the heritage, \add Even\add* unto the land that floweth with milk and honey.
The Lord gave strength also unto Caleb, Which remained with him unto his old age: So that he entered upon the high places of the land, And his seed obtained \add it for\add* an heritage:
That all the children of Israel might see That \add it is\add* good to follow the Lord.
And \add concerning\add* the judges, every one by name, Whose heart went not a whoring, Nor departed from the Lord, Let their memory be blessed.
Let their bones flourish out of their place, And let the name of them that were honoured \add be\add* continued upon their children.
Samuel, the prophet of the Lord, beloved of his Lord, Established a kingdom, and anointed princes over his people.
By the law of the Lord he judged the congregation, And the Lord had respect unto Jacob.
By his faithfulness he was found a true prophet, And by his word he was known \add to be\add* faithful in vision.
He called upon the mighty Lord, When his enemies pressed \add upon him\add* on every side, When \add he\add* offered the sucking lamb.
And the Lord thundered from heaven, And with a great noise made his voice to be heard.
And he destroyed the rulers of the Tyrians, And all the princes of the Philistines.
And before \add his\add* long sleep he made protestations in the sight of the Lord and his anointed, I have not taken any manâ€™s goods, so much as a shoe: And no man did accuse him.
And after his death he prophesied, And shewed the king his end, And lift up his voice from the earth in prophecy, To blot out the wickedness of the people.
